website_summaries.verdict: Considering the price, we think this vacuum offers great suction.
pros: Multi-cyclonic core technology which means the vacuum can maintain suction power for longer than more simple systems
cons: Can't use it on hardwood floors since you can't turn off the brush roll

website_summaries.verdict: In spite of some concerns and limitations, this upright is a good choice for fans of the brand who are watching their budgets.
pros: Affordable yet comes with features users love in a vacuum, including a HEPA filtration system, lots of on-board tools, a long cord, and an easy-to-clean dirt cup
Cord rewind system keeps the cord neat and tangle-free
cons: The vacuum occasionally shuts off for unknown reason

website_summaries.verdict: This vacuum is a great value if you want a bagless model with lots of extras but don't want to pay a premium price.
pros: Offers Hoover's popular WindTunnel action in an affordable bagless model
Cord rewinds instantly with the touch of a pedal
cons: Suction is okay but occasionally misses some debris and pet hair
Vacuum may shut off sporadically for no apparent reason

customer_reviews.title: Best vacuum I have ever used!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Bissell or Eureka's for years. My Bissell broke 3 weeks ago. I have Aussies and they she'd a LOT, as you can see in the photo. 3 weeks of no vacuuming left a furry mess. The Hoover tackled it with no problem! It pulled so much sand and dust out of the carpet. My dogs are working dogs on my farm. Yes, I had to stop and empty the bin FREQUENTLY, but it was doing a great job getting all of the hair out of the carpet. I noted the vacuum has self-propulsion until the bin needs emptied. So, keep the bin cemptied and the vacuum does the work!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I’m excited this thing actually works!!!
customer_reviews.text: This things works! I’m very impressed by how much dog hair this vacuum picks up. I have huskies and my floor gets covered with hair. I have not seen my carpets this clean in a longtime. It was easy to put together and dumping the “dirty” stuff is a breeze. Yes the vacuum is a little heavier but you are getting quality not junk plastic and is well worth the price. I also love that the hose is clear so you can see any clogs that may occur from heavy dog hair. The attachments are also great. I’m in love and will highly recommend this vacuum to others
customer_reviews.author: Donna D.

customer_reviews.title: Works As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Purchased product about 1.5 months ago and used it many times since it was purchased. My early review suggests that the vacuum works as advertised. This unit replaced another brand that I had for 10 plus years. I must admit, the old dirt extracted from the carpet was amazing, even after the second sweep. With that, early on I am pleased with the vacuum, the suction power and ease of use. It is too early to tell about the reliability of the unit's performance down the road but again, if early indications carry over to a year or two, it's a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: parts breaking off during assembly
customer_reviews.text: Piece broke off during assembly ! I called customer service to see about replacement parts, waited on hold for 10 minutes then gave up. Fitting to attach brushes chipped and had two inch crack before I finished a single room!! How do these folks stay in business? Great suction, but plastic parts and fittings are worthless! Waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great vacume worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: More suction then my old vac. And it cost $400 or more dollars and claimed to be the world strongest suction... this vacume beat it in every aspect... great product
customer_reviews.author: Vicki

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t be more disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I had a different Hoover before that I loved but found myself ordering this one because it had better reviews when mine quit. I just unboxed it and used it for the first time and I couldn’t be more disappointed. First of all, when powered on, the suction is so strong you have to really use some muscle to vacuum. I’ve tried all the brush settings and none work well. Next, I’m finding more dirt outside the vacuum almost than in it (look at the red part of the pic). I just don’t know how I can keep this product.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Bartlett

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend! BTW
customer_reviews.text: Ok...I wasn't entirely sure that a vacuum around $100.00 would work this well. We have cats...they shed. Our old Oreck just wasn't doing the job anymore and took a chance on this vacuum. The amount of fur that this vacuum can pick up in one use is astonishing. The picture is what came out of the canister after two vacuums. It's about a volleyball mass of fur (remember, it's spring in Las Vegas, so the critters are shedding). Highly recommend! BTW, research the belts before you automatically buy (like I did), one of the ones we bought doesn't go with this vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: LuckyVegas

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Received today. Easy assembly and couldn’t wait to get it in action. Huge disappointment. With two long haired cats and a week of no sweeping awaiting the arrival of this new vacuum, the dirt cup has virtually nothing in it after a very challenging time of maneuvering it around the living room. I can plainly see cat hair and other debris on the carpet. In the event that I didn’t have it set properly for carpet height, I tried several adjustments. Not happy in the least with the performance. Sorry I put my beat up old Bissel out to the curb. Even worn out, it did a better job than this new vacuum. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: KindleOnFire

customer_reviews.title: Super sucking machine!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic machine. My entire house is carpet and this really worked well. I have been very impressed by the attachments, especially the hand vac, made quick work of the stairs and furniture. Two things I would change (but would not make me return, by any means): 1. Make the storage for the attachments a bit more secure. They fall off easily 2. Would love a retractable cord Other than that, I highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: This vacuum was a big mistake, cheaply made and awkward
customer_reviews.text: WE had a Hoover Wind tunnel for years and it worked great until it eventually gave up the ghost. I order this as a replacement. It does not work well. The on and off button is hard to work, and sometimes it won't start at all, other times it will...after consistent and persistent pushing on the button. The tools are placed in ways that make it difficult to maneuver the machine, and switching between hard floors and carpet and moving the adjustment for carpet depth is really hard. Don't buy this machine. Also, it doesn't remind the cord, my fault for not noticing, but it just adds to the junk factor for this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandgus

customer_reviews.title: Not meant for Pet Hair
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this vacuum because it mentioned that it was made for Pet Hair. As time went on we would have to go over the area of dog hair several times in order for all of the hair to be picked up. We have only had this vacuum since the end of April and as of Friday 8/09/19, this vacuum is no longer picking up at all. I expected more since Hoover is a well know brand name so I didn't feel that I should need to pay the extra amount for a warranty. I will be glad to send this machine back to Hoover so that they can hopefully come up with better products.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Not self-propelled & heavy
customer_reviews.text: so sorry to report that I returned this vacuum. It was extremely difficult to maneuver and was very heavy. It picked up beautifully -- so a point for that! I did not realize it was not "self propelled". I am now back to the drawing board in making a new selection.
customer_reviews.author: Jan H. Sweyer

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum with a few exceptions
customer_reviews.text: I use this vacuum almost weekly to clean up after my dog who sheds constantly. It's great for carpet and the tools that come with it are useful for cleaning hair off of the furniture. I do have a few complaints. The biggest is that the side clip that holds the hose in place is very poorly made. I've had two of these vacuums and the clip broke on both of them after the first couple of uses. Also it's a little heavy, which makes it burdensome to vacuum stairs. Overall, I recommend, but I wish the manufacture would put a little more effort into the design/quality.
customer_reviews.author: km

customer_reviews.title: Filth be gone!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, I didn't even think my carpets were dirty. But look at that picture. That is from one SMALL bedroom, and we don't wear our shoes inside. Needless to say, this vacuum works wonderfully. I like the pet hair attachment in particular, but the brush and suction are amazing too. I'm shocked at how much dirt this thing found the first time around, and continues to find. I like the cord rewind factor as well, though I wish it was a bit longer. Note that you CANNOT turn the beater brush off, so it doesn't really work for hardwoods - that's fine for me, as I have a steam mop/vac combo (bissel symphony) for my hardwoods.
customer_reviews.author: JNG

customer_reviews.title: Still have and use it 5 years later!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe I still have this vacuum! Now we have a pet cat, and this thing is great at getting her hair out of the carpet. I remember I bought it because it seemed like a great value for all of the positive reviews, and the fact that I still have and use it definitely attests to its durability and quality. We use the extra appendages (is that what they're called?) as well. I love that you can clean the filter yourself at home, and I love how easy it is to unload and empty the chamber. It pulls A LOT of cat hair out of the carpet. Would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Rita's Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Great Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Look at the size difference. The suction is WAY better than my DC24. It’s heavier, which means it sticks to the carpet as opposed to the other one that floats over the top and leaves a lot behind. You’ll actually see where the Hoover has been because of its tracks that tell you where it’s clean. I don’t need to tell you about the price difference, either. Very Happy
customer_reviews.author: AH

customer_reviews.title: Good and bad
customer_reviews.text: This is the third unit that I have owned of this particular model type and although they have good suction power and are reasonably inexpensive something on them always seems to break. I just bought a 4th Hoover, different model.... since 2015. We always keep one upstairs and one downstairs so of the four that I have purchased in five years two of them have failed. If the one I purchased this week dies prematurely it's the last Hoover product I will ever buy.
customer_reviews.author: K.New

customer_reviews.title: It’s a vacuum ... it works  ... just not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: 2 stars bc they sent an older model in new model box . Disappointed to say the least but too lazy to send back . With a toddler, 2 teenagers , 2 dogs , 2 cats , a couple of Guinea pigs , and a husband we needed a vacuum . Other one I had broke . It’s a good vacuum and does the job . Just not exactly what I ordered . Plus got a good deal on cyber Monday.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware - Hoover UH72625
customer_reviews.text: The vacuum does not match Amazon's image, nor the image on the box it was shipped in. The original order came and there was no hose/floor switch on the side. A replacement was sent and the issue was the same. I felt like this could be potentially a counterfeit model since the box, direction nor the website completely matched what was in the box. (The first photo is from the initial order. The photos of the box and other vacuum was from the replacement.)
customer_reviews.author: TennisCoachHall

customer_reviews.title: This one was garbage
customer_reviews.text: I cant believe how little time it took for this thing to stop working. We bought this end of Oct 2019 and by March we had to replace the belt, which is fine, except that this didn't solve the problem apparently. I dont know what the heck the problem is at this point. It doesn't roll unless on the highest level and then even then it still isnt picking much up. Nothing is clogged. Pointless. I'm so incensed at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Volbriecht Ortrun Solvein

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a month
customer_reviews.text: Vacuum wouldn't stay on after a month of using it once a week. Now when it works for maybe 5 minutes it is also making a horrible noise. Hoover said they would replace it, but won't pay for shipping AND that it will take about 5 weeks total to get us a new one. I have 3 kids and living without a vacuum for that long is impossible.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Suction problems after ~6 months
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the better constructed "economy priced" vacuum cleaners out there. However, it is functionally fragile losing almost all of its suction power after 6 short months. I don't own pets and have only ever used it on my new carpet - so there's no reason for it to crap out other than poor design. I read somewhere that people were fixing the problem by taking the back panel off and using an air compressor to "blow out" the engine. I might try that, but in the meantime, I have a $100 ugly green doorstop.
customer_reviews.author: Xantier M. Werner

customer_reviews.title: I wish it worked better.
customer_reviews.text: Had this machine for nearly two years and I struggled throughout to make it work. First, the power cord is too short and I have to use an extension. Also it always seems to get in the way of the wheels and my legs and that makes it a danger for falls. But, I finally gave up when I realised that it just wasn't picking up much. The motor creates sufficient suction when using the extensions but the flow is just too low to pick anything up. I keep looking to see if the hose was clogged. Finally gave up and returned to my 25 year old Kenmore canister.
customer_reviews.author: R. Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum for price
customer_reviews.text: I love this vacuum. I’ve had it for a few months and I’ve had no problems. I love the retractable cord and how it’s easy to empty the canister. Very good value for the price- in my opinion. I will update if I have any issues. I also love the tools it comes with. The crevasse tool is a life safer! I vacuum pretty often so it seems to work well for my cat’s hair... but it doesn’t get 100% of it. I would say about 85-90% for me. But I think if you have a LOT of hair, maybe from build up or just a very hairy animal, it might be more difficult for the vacuum to remove it.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Y.

customer_reviews.title: A Terrific Vac!
customer_reviews.text: This replaces a similar vac that has simply worn out over the years. I ran it over a carpet that had been thoroughly cleaned by the old machine. I was amazed with the amount of mostly very fine dust that was recovered. Amazing! The dust cup was mostly filled up again. Very pleased with this machine. The old one was highly rated by CR about 10 years ago, but it is more worn out than it appeared with the duct tape and scratches. It really does a fine job, and demonstrates that you can get an excellent machine at a reasonable price, right around $100. I recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor J

customer_reviews.title: Great light vac from Hoover.
customer_reviews.text: Good Old Hoover...good vac. Easy to put together, easy to clean! Great suction...
customer_reviews.author: MaryAnn

customer_reviews.title: Pretty darn good vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good; the extra attachments are very helpful for cleaning dust off fans and vents in the home plus they work pretty well for cleaning the car. Pet hair extension works but really only helpful for fabric, of course. Suction is good and the brushes do a good, but not exceptional, job for old carpeting. Dust canister has good capacity and is super easy to empty. No negatives worth mentioning right away but I do wonder about the long term durability of the plastic hoses.
customer_reviews.author: A Real Person

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Like many others, I have had a Dyson for several years. Needed an extra vacuum because it was just a pain to carry the vacuum up and down 16 steps. So I thought why not save a bit of $$ for the second vacuum? Well, this is absolutely a case of you get what you pay for. Bought this on April 9, 2018 and two years later it's just a piece of junk. Sunction worked fantastic the first 6 months and then I noticed that it would leave stuff behind. Now it's completely not "hoovering" up anything and I'm back to lugging my vacuum cleaner up and down the stairs again. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Christina C.

customer_reviews.title: great vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I liked the suction power and it really is easy to empty the dirt. The only thing I found difficult is the on - off button - it is a push on/off and can be hard to use . I am elderly so I need to really concentrate on shutting it off. Maybe as time goes on it will be easier for me. But I certainly would recommend this vacuum. I don't have stairs so I could not rate this.
customer_reviews.author: Mary R. Bates

customer_reviews.title: previous very happy  hoover owner -  new machine very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This particular model is difficult to - maneuver and turn on. The on/off button is difficult to depress to activate. The handle feels flimsy and not sturdy especially when navigating around corners. when lifting the machine to carry up/down stairs results in the canister detaching from suction connector - need to remove and reinsert canister. Do not recommend. Machine stopped working after 6 uses!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does great picking up dog hair!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the Kirby vacuum I've had for the past few years. I'm too old (and lazy) to have to take a vacuum apart to use different attachments, so I now have a happy granddaughter! This vacuum does just as good a job as the Kirby when it comes to picking up dog hair from my heavy shedding dogs, without the hassle of having to take parts off and put them back on when you want to use a hose or other attachment. It picks up great, is easy to empty, and I'm very satisfied with it. Another plus, I no longer have to buy replacement bags! I think it was money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: yankeemamaTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: 2 husky home. Company sent refurb.
customer_reviews.text: 2huksy owner. This product came used. It must have been a refurb. The contents chamber smelled like mold & there was dirt on its wheels in the plastic in the box. We still put it together & tried it. We have short pile rugs, hardwood floors & 2 Siberian Husky's. The vacuum left trails of fur behind on the hardwood floors & did not get the hair off the rug in our office where they primarily nap. The suction just wasn’t there. We packed this up & sent it back. We did end up purchasing the bissell pet hair and I can say we are 100% satisfied with that model as it does get all the fur.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Musgrove

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I read many reviews on this vacuum before I purchased it. Many of the negative reviews do not seem to be warranted after my experience with it. Yes, it doesn't have a retractable cord. But, I had a vacuum before that the retract mechanism broke and there was nowhere to store the cord. It has sufficient suction for every task I have used it for. The price made this an attractive purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mastifflawyer

customer_reviews.title: Great little vacuum for most jobs
customer_reviews.text: One thing Hoover does right is make it easy to understand the machine. I had a Bissell bagless vacuum which could be mistaken for the twin of this one. That is, upon first glance. Then you realize that the controls on the Bissell are in a stupid location or non-intuitive. The Hoover on-off switch is at your fingertip on the handle. The pedal at the base release the head to vacuum. Grab the front of the hollow chamber (where the big grab handle is) and the release is right there at your thumb. This is a pleasure to use. It is usually 99.99 and sometimes on sale for 79.99.
customer_reviews.author: J. Comeaux

customer_reviews.title: Great all around vac at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Consumer Reports liked this vacuum and gave it a best buy. I have to agree. I have always had canister style vacs, and while not perfect in all respects, this upright bagless vac does a great job all around and has a very attractive price/value. Great suction power and cleans all floors very well. Id like to be able to turn brushes off but it doesn't really hamper all around cleaning tasks. The small power brush attachment works great on stairs and furniture. This vac is light weight and quite portable, and takes up little space in the hall storage closet. It handles well and overall I am very pleased with this purchase. A bargain at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce D.

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is awesome! I bought it for a little over sixty bucks and worth every penny! I vacuumed my living room with a dirt devil first then went behind with this Hoover and it picked up so much leftover dirt (see picture). Pros - retractable cord, which is also long - great suction - works great on hardwood floors - canister is easy to detach and empty - vacuum is lightweight - power button is conveniently placed near handle - so easy to assemble with just a few pieces (The only) Con The hose is weird. It drags (see pic)
customer_reviews.author: Rosa LuMing

customer_reviews.title: Beats Most More Expensive Vacuums
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum was easy to assemble. The suction rivals more expensive vacuums. After using it the first time, it caught more dirt than my Dyson ever did. (The Dyson was about $300.) The key is to set the brush height to the lowest setting even on high carpet, as the manual suggests. This may produce some extra drag, but if you can handle it, the vacuum will do an excellent job. I don't know how it will perform over time, but it didn't seem to have a problem with my medium length hair.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat disappointed
customer_reviews.text: What was IN THE BOX was not what was advertised at Amazon (this has changed since my purchase) or shown on the box. The vacuum was missing the Brushroll On/Off Switch - Turn on/off brushroll for optimal cleaning on carpets and hard floors, though it was in the literature. I called Hoover and they said that this item had been discontinued but the packaging had not been changed. Shouldn't advertise something that is NO LONGER AVAILABLE without telling people.
customer_reviews.author: Grampa Rov

customer_reviews.title: Good for the $ would buy again
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum has a powerful suction! It worked great for about 4 years but then it stopped working. I got rid of it and am now kicking myself for not trying to fix it. I think it might have lost suction from dog hair getting clogged in the tubing. I cleaned the roller and detached the hose but I get if I would’ve cleaned more of the tube it would’ve fixed it
customer_reviews.author: Abby Ward

customer_reviews.title: Worst
customer_reviews.text: when I try to change the direction I am vacuuming it becomes difficult to push. When I called to address the issue I was told to bring it for service. The service place they approved was almost an hour away from my place. I was told there that it works fine. The issue was “the carpeting” I have. Sorry but that is absurd! Plus the changing from one carpet height to another or from carpet to floor is super complicated. AND the attachment to use on the stairs jammed after the third use. The repair shop told me not to use it for “heavy duty”. I didn’t think that using a “pet friendly” vaccume with3 cats was considered “heavy duty”!
customer_reviews.author: Cara O'Donnell

customer_reviews.title: CONVENIENT BUT REALLY NOISY!!!
customer_reviews.text: A nice handy little vac but has some significant flaws. First, it's really very noisy, has a high-pitch whine that can cut through you. Second, it doesn't haven't a light on it so I can see under chairs, tables, etc. Third, the hose is too short as well as the extension wand which really only extends it about 12 inches. On the plus side, there is a cord wind-up, which is a nice feature and you don't have to buy bags to change like diapers and it's easy to empty without mess.
customer_reviews.author: K.D.

customer_reviews.title: Not working after less than a year
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this in October of 2019. In July 2020 it started shutting down randomly while I was vacuuming. I called customer service and cleaned out all of the tubing. It worked slightly better for a bit. But not long later, it continued to shut down randomly and would not restart for several hours. It also started spitting back out the dirt that I had vacuumed. It would take me twice as long to vacuum a room because I had to continuously re-vacuum the areas I just vacuumed. After less than a year, this vacuum is completely useless.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Jay

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Our Use
customer_reviews.text: We have been using an earlier version of the wind tunnel for a number of years. It worked well for us so when it came time to replace we stayed with a Hoover. Sure glad we did. We have a modest sized condo with two golden retrievers. I have been using our portable Dyson for spot cleaning and the older wind tunnel for general cleaning. The first use of our new Hoover made the significant improvement apparent. We shouldn't have waited so long.
customer_reviews.author: SteveS

customer_reviews.title: great suction!
customer_reviews.text: Love this vacuum. Great suction. With 3 dogs, does very well picking up hair. Easy to empty and clean out. It's a heavy-duty vacuum, but it's still easy enough to maneuver. All of the tools are very functional, I especially like the small crevice device, it gets into tiny spaces well and the dusting brush cleans shelves and window blinds easily. The only criticism I might speak to, is the fact that the plastic the tools are made from, seems a little light weight, but so far i'v not had any issues with them.
customer_reviews.author: lindylu

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this during amazon lightning deal for around $70. I like it so far and no problems. Comes with a two year warranty. I have called hoover customer service for other products and have had great success with their warranty claims. Its powerful and picks up everything. I like the cord winder but seems like that will be the first thinks that breaks from repeated use. I will updated if anything breaks down with this vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Overall great vacuum.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace a 20 year old Hoover wind tunnel which finally broke beyond repair. Overall I really like it. I don’t think it will last as long it’s predecessor since mike most consumer appliances. It’s not made like it used to be, however, the build quality is good. Things I liked : easy to assemble, bag less, wide cleaning path while still being maneuverable. Things I don’t like : power button is awkward to handle (Not sure why they went with a button vs rocker switch), there is a trick to getting the dirt canister back on and sometimes struggle.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M. Seward

customer_reviews.title: Super power at a low price
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace the vacuum cleaner that I had for seven or eight years. It was still good but I broke the cord auto rewind mechanism and it was going to cost more to fix it that buy a new machine. I bought the exact same vacuum. It had always been just great and I was pleased that Hoover still made it. I looked at many machines before I re-bought this one. Forget the $700.00 cordless ones. Buy this for under &100.00 and save the rest. Great machine.
customer_reviews.author: D. Peters

customer_reviews.title: Mixed feelings
customer_reviews.text: Pro’s: Works like a dream. Just for giggles I vacuumed the carpet with our old vacuum, then I vacuumed it with this new one. Grrooossss!!! Half the canister was full of pet hair and dirt. So glad we got this new one. It’s a beast! Cons: Right out of the box the hose is deformed and caked with some sort of white stuff. It’s always nice to have something nice and new, and the hose like this makes it look ugly.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Avoid The Fray
customer_reviews.text: Loved this vacuum UNTIL three months into using it the retractable cord frayed from being retracted. Now it won’t work at all. It vacuumed up dog hair, it cleaned floors and carpets equally well and and was light and easy to use. I am disappointed in its short life. What could have been a 5 star rating is now reduced. Not sure if the retractable design is something I would do again, or choose a different vacuum/design.
customer_reviews.author: FAH

customer_reviews.title: Vacuums well......
customer_reviews.text: .....picks up pet hair on rugs and floors, and is much lighter than my previous vacuum. Some of the extras are a bit lacking. The powered upholstery brush stops working when you put any pressure on it, which if you have pets, means it basically doesn't work on upholstery. Also the hose for the accessories is extremely short, which makes it not very convenient to use. I like the power cord rewind, but I don't like having the cord coming from the bottom, as one must hold it up to avoid running it over with the vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: boudicea

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Product
customer_reviews.text: The vacuum does not have a good/strong seal between the collection canister and the suction tube. As a result, the majority of the dust, dirt, paper, or anything else you pick with it, will fly out through the large gap. The vacuum also felt like it was made of very cheap materials, for example, the rubber seals and the hose were very thin and felt like you could tare them very easily. This is by far one of the poorest made products I have ever purchased.
customer_reviews.author: A_Sir

customer_reviews.title: Cord frayed in 8 months inside the retracting housing!!!
customer_reviews.text: The vacuum worked as needed for 8 months, then the vacuum just quit this morning. After investigating, I found the cord frayed nearly in half inside the retracting housing. Have had Hoover’s before and this must be a major design flaw for this model. Would not recommend his vacuum. If the cord issue is not caught in time. I could see an electrical fire issue possible happening.
customer_reviews.author: Elm Street Photography, Milo Maine

customer_reviews.title: Too short lived
customer_reviews.text: Good while it lasted - we owned this 3 years and used it lightly. After 2.5 years, the plastic latch on the dust container broke and you had to be careful not to dump dirt when emptying it. It recently died completely. It was good, but too short lived.
customer_reviews.author: Texan

customer_reviews.title: So VERY glad I went back to Hoover!
customer_reviews.text: Finally a vacuum built with me in mind! Solidly built with a strong engine, at 18 pounds this engine almost pulls itself forward . Has nice bumpers to protect furniture. The foot operated "suction only button" allows me to vacuum those little area rugs without sucking them up! No more fighting with the hose because it has a lock and release button. The articulating duster gets top shelves with ease. Longer cord keeps me moving fast through a large farm house filled with dirt no more!
customer_reviews.author: CassKenn

customer_reviews.title: I'm so disappointed. This is my second time buying
customer_reviews.text: I'm so disappointed. This is my second time buying. The first time was five years ago and I loved it. After a series of moves and lost vacuums, I recently decided to buy this vacuum again. It is not the same quality. It is twice as loud and the hose is awful, not only does it not extend as much as my first one, when you detach it from the vacuum there is no cover on the opening and it blows particles back out. I wanted to return it, but was in the middle of moving for the third time in 4 months and missed the return time. I'm donating it to the local thrift store.
customer_reviews.author: MEG G

customer_reviews.title: Picks up so much hair and dust you can’t even see!
customer_reviews.text: (All these pictures are of this dog vacuum after I used a regular vacuum I had at home) Hands down my favorite amazon purchase!!! We vacuum our carpet every day we even use the dog broom often and when I used this vaccuum it still picked up so much hair and dust! (We own a chocolate lab so they don’t shed nearly as much as other breeds.)Super easy to put together and it’s light to push. I am super satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Terrible performance on hard surface floors
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this vacuum in August and now in December, we need to replace it. Suction is terrible. Performs okay on carpet, if you can get it to go. It seems to get stuck and is very difficult to push. Absolutely does not work on hard surface floors. Just pushes dust, crumbs, etc. across the floor. Attachments keep falling off. I could have torn up $150 and then swept it up with a broom and dustpan and gotten the same experience.
customer_reviews.author: TXMomto3

customer_reviews.title: Excellent vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Works great! From bare floors to deep pile carpet, the adjustments make it easy to clean whatever you have. It maneuvers very well and makes it quick and easy to get around and under things as well. Does a great job right up next to the wall and the suction on the sides is just as good as the center. The built-in cord reel is fantastic and makes it quick to put away when you're done. It was very easy to dump the dust and I didn't have to touch any of it. Would work well for anyone from a single to a busy house with pets. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: They don’t make em like they used to!
customer_reviews.text: Had it for 6 months and got a very slim sleeve stuck in the vacuum for less than 10 seconds. The vacuum completely stopped working. Tried multiple fixes and it would only heat up to dangerous levels. Save your money and buy something else that will last.
customer_reviews.author: Livette

customer_reviews.title: Great value, fantastic vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: This thing has amazing suction and gets the job done both on carpet and wood floors. We’re very pleased with this vacuum. Only negative would awkwardness with the hand held pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Barry

customer_reviews.title: This is a WINNER!
customer_reviews.text: I was so on the fence with this purchase based on the reviews. People loved it, people hated it ..blah blah blah. In all truthfulness this is one of the BEST vacuums I have ever owned.It has amazing suction and pulled so much from my carpet that I was slightly sickened. I vacuum often and consider my place clean but when I saw what this machine picked up I had to write an immediate review. The price in my opinion is affordable and it comes with all kinds of attachments. I used one of the attachments to clean my couch and again it was amazing.
customer_reviews.author: staceyclaire

customer_reviews.title: A very good vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good vacuum. The suction could be better but it is sufficient. The retractable cord is great. It is quite long and does retract well. Don't know what years of use will do. It is lighter than my old vacuum. But the one thing I do not like is the fact that the hose is not long enough. I use it a lot because I have wood floors and grandsons. The price was good as well.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Great Basic Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum (UH70120) is a great basic vacuum. It is bag-less, HEPA filtered and has automatic cord rewind and auto switching between floor and hose. A step up is the WindTunnel Max Multi-Cyclonic Bagless Upright (UH70600) that includes those features plus a foot pedal to turn off the floor brush for wood floors. These are the two best Hoover's I've ever owned. I also purchase the UH72630PC which was the worst vacuum I've ever owned (I'm old, I've owned a few!).
customer_reviews.author: Monte

customer_reviews.title: Very loud and annoying
customer_reviews.text: I probably should have returned this vacuum because it's so annoying to use. It makes a high pitched squeal besides the usual motor noise. I called cust. service and was told to take it to a service center, but the nearest one is over 3 hrs. round trip so I'll continue to use it but wear ear plugs. Even without the squeal, it's way too loud.
customer_reviews.author: Pat N

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced, poorly engineered
customer_reviews.text: Was very easy to assemble and worked well out of the box. Vacuum broke after 1 year. Suction is no longer powerful enough to suck up dog hair. The roller tool it came with broke within the first few weeks. Extremely annoying and difficult to disassemble and clean also. Not well engineered. It's almost impossible to access the belt without snapping off some of the little plastic latches. Clogs with dog hair easily. Worked okay for a year and then broke. It's an okay vacuum, but way overpriced. It's worth maybe half its price. Can't recommend it for anyone who is looking for a high-end powerful vacuum for cleaning pet hair. (Might be fine for dirt/dust).
customer_reviews.author: Sierra

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed that the one piece of the vacuum that is most important in assembly was deficient!
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased this vacuum. The screw that secures the upper handle to the vacuum was too short and would not securely fasten the handle. Tried to contact Hoover customer service. On hold for over 30 minutes. Told to push 1 for a call back but this did nothing but return me to their recording. Emailed Hoover. No,response yet. Hoping a replacement screw will work. Wondering how long I can wait for an answer from them before I must return this item to Amazon. I am using tape to hold the handle for now. Otherwise the vacuum works well. This vacuum was well rated by Consumer's Reports. Hope it can easily be fixed.
customer_reviews.author: janeo

customer_reviews.title: Great suction and ease of operation
customer_reviews.text: I was unsure how I would like this bagless vacuum but it is fantastic great suction, simple transition from carpet to hard floor setting, easy to maneuver. Only problem I had was pressing the on button. It is not a switch or slide but rubber and I had a hard time finding the correct angle and pressure. No problem now. Very happy with this product at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy. Not worth the money whatsoever!
customer_reviews.text: Cheapest pc of crap I’ve ever spent money on. The plastic extender doesn’t stay extended. It keeps collapsing and also it certainly isn’t long enough!!! After just 5 uses, the cheap plastic holding the utility brush broke off. I only used that brush once. The only good thing to say about this is the pet roller brush. Great suction. I will trash the vacuum and keep the pet roller brush.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Henderhan

customer_reviews.title: Nice Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good vacuum. Has good suction and I like the retracting cord and suction-powered mini brush. The hose could be improved, as it isn't very long to reaching high areas, such as for sucking up cobwebs. (UPDATE: wanted to add that there are two filters in this machine. The top filter is washable, and the bottom HEPA filter is replaceable. I have washed the top filter a couple times and it seems very well-made. Should last through plenty of washings in between the multitude of times I simply bang out the dust.)
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Jerew

customer_reviews.title: I am so pleased with this Hoover!
customer_reviews.text: I have been a Hoover fan for years and have a smaller one and a larger one than this product at home, both worn and weary. This particular Hoover is just the right size for me--lightweight and so easy to use! It has features such as the retractable cord that make vacuuming easier than ever, and the lightweight-ness of it does not hurt my back like my big Hoover does. I am so very pleased with this that I bought another one for my daughter who has back issues and will find this so helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Smith

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed in this brand name vac
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this vac on 9/28/15. I've already had to replace a broken rubber belt that turns the vacuum part. Now, the other day the little button/switch that releases the attachment hose broke off. I can't fix it. How am I supposed to use the attachments? We have a tiny two bedroom cottage with only a living room/kitchen combo. We are seniors so I do not have to do a lot of vacuuming. I have owned Hoovers all my adult life. I am very disappointed in this brand name vac. Compared to regular Hoovers, this one is way overpriced. I would not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Firstly,I think I was sent a returned item. The box was ripped al;l the way down the side and missing tool. I would have kept it anyway if it were usable.It is VERY loud!!! My dogs were terrified.Even my boy who follows me as I vacuum and sits in the middle of the floor ran and hid in the corner :-( It also does NOT seal well,AT ALL,blew a lot of dust back into the air and on me.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Carpet Cleaning Tool
customer_reviews.text: This product was a replacement from the former model purchased 7 years ago. The pickup of cat hair and small pieces of “schmutz” is efficient and amazing. The model that we bought does not have the self propel function (which was dysfunctional in the previous model). No bags, just a canister and filters to empty.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lewin

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: I know there’s no perfect vacuum cleaner out there including this one. They all have something that’s going to irritate someone. I’ve used this vacuum brand/style for the past year at my mother’s house. I liked it well enough to purchase one for myself. I’ve always been of fan of Hoover and this is no exception.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing cleaning poewr
customer_reviews.text: Good suction power and cleans the carpet real good. Easy to move on the wheels. Good length cord for covering-a good amount of area without looking for a new electric point Easy to clean and easy to throw away the dirt collected - just click n the dust falls out
customer_reviews.author: sunitha

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I snapped the handle off my other Hoover vacuum. I loved it and I was soooo upset. I got this vacuum and it so far has been great! I still love my other one better but what can I say. The only thing that drives me crazy with this vacuum is that I have to turn a dial for floor or wand. I wish that when you took wand off that the suction immediately went to it and vice versa.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must Have for pet hair!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this vacuum based off of other reviews that were left and on it being featured in an article titled "5 best Vacuums for Pet Hair" Let me tell you, I was impressed. There was an extreme difference in the smell and look of each room. My pup has fine little hairs that sit on top of the carpet that the Roomba typically misses. One pass with this vacuum and it was all gone. It's a little bulky so it can be hard to maneuver, but it comes with plenty of tools to get in all of your hard to reach places and is perfect for rooms without many obstacles.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Brown

customer_reviews.title: Think twice
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this vacuum to replace a Shark Navigator. We didn’t want to spend a lot and I guess we got what we paid for. It worked okay for a few months but was never great. Emptying the debris canister is a dirty job and the suction is just okay but I thought, we’ll i can’t expect miracles for what I spent. After 8 months of using this vacuum, all I want is a new one. The suction is now awful, the rotating brush is awful, it’s hard to push and it is heavy. Big mistake purchasing this, so think twice if you’re considering this vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: kimberjmb

customer_reviews.title: Save your money, Keep Looking!!
customer_reviews.text: Piece of garbage, save your money and keep looking! This vaccume worked ok for a few months, now hardly sucks anything up! The hose piece can't even pick up a Cheerio!! Also the hose constantly gets clogged from the contents that's supposed to be going into the main canister, and you have to completely dissasble it and use a broom handle to clear the hose, leaving a mess everywhere, the bottom piece that holds the roller and band in place, constantly pops off, and the thing Smells like it's over heating on a regular basis! Do yourself a favor, keep your sanity and your money, and keep looking!!
customer_reviews.author: Mommy of 3 Princesses & a Prince

customer_reviews.title: Not for me, probably not for you either.
customer_reviews.text: No! Well, almost certainly no. The brush never stops spinning. Not when you lock it upright. There is no manual disconnect. It comes with tools you can't use because what are you going to do with the spinning brush? Leave it to wear hole in your carpet or start a fire on your hardwood? I bought this and regret it because I end carrying it around while I use the hose with attachments to do the kitchen and hardwood floors, baseboards, etc. Or I lay it on its back. And I wear earplugs when I do that because it's so loud. If you are only ever going to vacuum carpet this unit is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Scammon

customer_reviews.title: Repeat Buyer, First One Lasted Eight Years, Great for Hardwoods/Tile, Motorized Attachment Works Well Too
customer_reviews.text: Second one we've owned. First one lasted about eight years. We have all hardwood and tile, this vacuum works well on those surfaces. We have a white Shepard/Lab mix and unfortunately, he gains the shedding of both breeds! We make heavy use of the motorized attachment for vacuuming under cushions, upholstery, car floorboard carpets etc where pet hair can be suborn to vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Ossie Moore

customer_reviews.title: Powerful vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I had a Hoover vacuum for over 20 years which is a reliable product. I am so happy that I purchased the Hoover wind tunnel bagless upright I can’t believe how powerful this vacuum is compared to the old one that I used to have. The assembly was very easy also. I recommend this vacuum very highly. Plus the shipping was excellent. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: makes some noise and the cat and dog probably won't like it. You will
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to replace a very expensive, very complicated upright vacuum cleaner. This machine vacuums and does an exceptional job of it. It DOESN'T have 51 accessories, a headlight, taillight and backup alarm, 14 forward speeds and a cup holder. It IS inexpensive and functional. It has a motor, makes some noise and the cat and dog probably won't like it. You will. We have a 1500 sq.ft. house with wall-to-wall carpet, 2 adults, no pets and we vacuum the carpet twice a week. First time we used it we initially vacuumed with the aging and overpriced machine then with the inexpensive Hoover. Astounding difference. The old machine has been donated to charity, the new machine works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Westech

customer_reviews.title: Best bagless buy for your money
customer_reviews.text: Great vacuum cleaner. Found out later was top rated in consumer reports as well. Every vacuum cleaner should have their rewindable about cord. It's bagless so you have to accept that it won't be as easy to clean as a bagged vacuum cleaner. But the design makes it relatively easy to clean especially if you do it within the confines of a trashcan. We had a older Hoover dimension bagged cleaner. I was amazed how much dirt and stuff this vacuum cleaner picked up right after vacuuming with the old vacuum cleaner. It is obviously more powerful yet it is quieter than the old unit. We've had it about a year now I think and it is held up well
customer_reviews.author: Steve-o

customer_reviews.title: Awesome vacuum! Works on hardwood, carpet & tile floors!
customer_reviews.text: I love this vacuum sweeper. I am onto my 2nd one of these! I rotated my 1st one to our office to use cause the office needed a vacuum & I got a this new replacement (same vacuum). Both work great!! This vacuum works great on carpet, tile & hardwood floors! Consumer Reports also highly recommends this vacuum!
customer_reviews.author: DIY’er Fam

customer_reviews.title: Light-Weight Yet Powerful Mom Pleaser
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our mom--not because we're insensitive, gender-biased kids, but because she *wanted* a new one. That said, we researched the top models and picked this one. And she loves it. It is lighter than her old Hoover Windtunnel, yet appears to generate more suction. Still--ask before you give a vacuum as a gift. She's still mad about the crockpot from last year.
customer_reviews.author: Leo D.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent  Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum performs as you would expect a Hoover to perform. I have owned Hoover’s most of my life and have grown to expect the best from them. The long cord is one of the features I always look for. I have newer carpet throughout my home and it can handle the different heights and textures keeping them all clean and looking brand new. Easy to put together and easy maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: B B

customer_reviews.title: Less-than-ideal
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Cheap Long cord Easy to dispose of vacuumed material No bags Cons: Isn't sturdy Sporadically turns itself off and needs to be turned on again Has less-than-ideal suctioning (only underneath/slightly in front, not a good range) Takeaway: Probably more trouble than it's worth and would not buy again, but was cheaper than most/all the other vacuums in it's category by a considerable margin.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Very Powerful
customer_reviews.text: We bought the same model perhaps a year ago. Works great. Liked it so much decided to buy a second one for upstairs - good decision!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mixed review
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum has great suction and is easy to push. The negatives are as follows-if you bump the canister at all or don’t wiggle it just right it makes a high pitched whistling sound. Also the cord is obnoxiously short. I understand it’s retractable so it can’t be as long as a windup cord, but this is just ridiculous. I don’t know that I would buy it again but I’m making it work for now.
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: Same Model, Different Result
customer_reviews.text: The HEPA filter "drawer" will not stay shut when vacuuming. I sent a note to Hoover customer service and they directed me to a local service dealer who has atrocious reviews online (people wait months to get their sweepers repaired, rude employees, etc). I am saddened as I have always owned a Hoover and am surprised that this model (which is the same as I had previously) is so inferior to its predecessor. The cord return is hard to press down as well. Will be buying another vacuum (not a Hoover).
customer_reviews.author: A. Price

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: Expected higher quality. Plastic parts seem cheap, but have held up so far. The retractable cord is nice, but WAY too short. I’m constantly having to unplug and find another outlet. The canister can be finicky after it has been emptied and you are trying to snap it back into place. It does seem to pick up dirt and pet hair and I like that I can adjust the beater height. It’s fairly light and easy to push. It’s okay, but I would not buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Telford

customer_reviews.title: Just buy a higher end vacuum cleaner if you can
customer_reviews.text: I'll admit, I bought this vacuum cleaner because I thought it would be of higher quality than the price indicated: I was completely wrong. It acted just like any old 90-100$ vacuum cleaner. While it did an OK job vacuuming, I did not find it special or could not make it do an amazing job cleaning my house. I ended up getting a basic Dyson vacuum and found it to clean at least 20-30% better (even though it did cost 50-75$ more). Pay more = cleaner house!
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: This machine came with an excellent review in Consumer Reports and Amazon had a great ...
customer_reviews.text: This machine came with an excellent review in Consumer Reports and Amazon had a great price. When I first used it, I was very impressed- lightweight, great suction, no bags to deal with. The second time it was used, however, it started smoking from somewhere underneath and inside for no obvious reason and the cord was extremely hot. I have used it twice since then for a short amount of time (because sending a vacuum back through the mail is a bit challenging when you've already recycled the box it came in) and emptied the canister and did not see any smoke. I'm too nervous to keep it now though.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Rogers

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with this vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Almost 3 years later it still runs strong and and the cord retractor still works as new. I am very happy with this vacuum! I found out that you can’t vacuum up poly fil. That white fluffy stuff. Don’t vacuum this with ANY vacuum! It can up like concrete in the hose . I had to cut the hose to get it out. I’m looking now for a replacement hose and thought I would update with a review. My only criticism the attachment last don’t stay on the holder
customer_reviews.author: Watcher

customer_reviews.title: More durable plastics needs to be used.
customer_reviews.text: This unit works good enough and picks up well but the hose and plastic parts are a weak point. The hose has broken in several places as well as some plastic parts and because of the high replacement part cost I simply taped glued parts back together. I am not impressed by the classic parts or the hose.
customer_reviews.author: L. Ebbing

customer_reviews.title: Great suction but messy to clean
customer_reviews.text: This is really a superior performing vaccuum with amazing suction. Only reason for 4 stars is same for any bagless vac, it is a dusty, dirty way to empty the contents. I would much rather deal with the expense of buying bags but the for the money you cant go wrong with the vac if you dont mind the clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Greetings from NY

customer_reviews.title: cleans and picks up dog hair great!
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that I can sweep my tile floors and then go into my bedroom, which is carpeted and sweep that without changing sweepers! picks up dog hairs and I swear it even smells better afterwards. I don't have stairs, so I didn't leave feedback for that one. It seems a little lighter than I expected and I love that!
customer_reviews.author: sharyn

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Didn't realize how much I miss my Shark Liftaway. I bought this because it had good consumer ratings. This Hoover works good on open floors but I can't get under large furniture that can't be moved- like my entertainment center. The hose that comes with it is average length and the 1.5 ft long attachment is all I can use to get under the furniture or to my ceiling fans. Very disappointed in the lack of attachments and accessories and since it's not a lift away, it's a bitch having to pull and lift the unit every step of the way. I'm going back to a Shark and using this as a backup unit.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsae

customer_reviews.title: This thing sucks!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for pet hair. I vacuumed a room with my old Eureka and then went over it with this Hoover and I was amazed at what it picked up. The bar floor vacuuming mode works great also. There are a few things I don't like. (1) The dust trap door has ridges that make dumping the contents out tedious. Dust/dirt sits in the crevice and when you close the flap it creates a huge mess. (2) The attachment storage isn't well thought out in my opinion, at least compared to my old Eureka. A good investment in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Hoover UH70120 T-Series WindTunnel Rewind Plus Upright Vacuum Cleaner, with HEPA Media Filtration, Lightweight and Corded, Green
product_meta.description: Color:GreenThe Hoover WindTunnel T-Series Rewind Plus Upright Vacuum is a vacuum with a removable dirt cup and accessory tools that remove deep down dirt from just about any surface in your house. With the 5 different vacuum head heights, you can clean any surface. Lower the head to glide easily and suck up debris from hard wood floors, or lift it to clean thick and shaggy carpets. The accessory pack helps you to clean every nook and cranny in your home. It comes with an extension wand, a crevice tool, a turbo tool, and a dusting brush. The HEPA Media filter is located at the base of the vacuum and traps 99.97% of dirt, dust, and pollen, down to 0.3 microns. For a vacuum that can clean anything in your home and is easy to use, get the Hoover WindTunnel T-Series Rewind Plus Upright Vacuum.
feature_bullets: Windtunnel technology: Creates suction to lift and remove surface debris and deeply embedded dirt
HEPA media filter: Traps 99.7 percent of dirt, dust and pollens down to 0.3 microns
Room to room cleaning: 5 height adjustments to go from deep carpet to hard floors and 25 foot retractable cord
No scuff bumper: Protects your furniture as you clean along edges of underneath
What’s included: Extension wand, crevice tool, upholstery/dusting brush, and powered hand tool

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars13,010 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
specifications.Specific Uses For Product: Hardwood Floors, Tile Floors, Carpet, Pet hairs
specifications.Included Components: Dusting Brush, Turbo Tool, Extension Wand, Crevice Tool
